metadata.template_skill: Student multi-selects pairs from a list that show equivalent fractions (notation format, no visuals)

telemetry_data.mastery_skill: Student can identify which pairs of fractions are equivalent

steps.dialogue: Here are some fraction pairs. Which ones show the same amount?

prompt.text: Select ALL pairs that are equivalent.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Remember, equivalent fractions show the same amount even though they look different. Try again.

Let's think about this together. Equivalent fractions represent the same amount of the whole. Look at each pair and ask yourself: do these two fractions show the same part? Sometimes the denominator is different but the amount is the same. Check each pair carefully.

Let me walk you through finding equivalent pairs. Let's check each one. 1/2 and 4/8: Half of something is the same as 4 out of 8 equal parts - both show the same amount, so these are equivalent. 1/4 and 2/8: One-fourth is the same as 2 out of 8 equal parts - they're equivalent too. And 2/4 and 3/6: 2/4 is half, and 3/6 is also half - so these are equivalent as well. The answers are pairs a, c, and f. That's how we identify equivalent fractions - we look for pairs that represent the same amount even when they have different denominators.

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You found the equivalent pairs.
